intro: Stachytarpheta lacunosa var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf stachytarpheta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its lanceolate to ovate leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
